title: Part (a)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that neither country has an absolute advantage in producing food and/or it does not explain that both countries are producing the same amount of food.
The response states that neither country has an absolute advantage in producing food and explains that both countries are producing the same amount of food.

title: Part (b)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that Teckana has a comparative advantage in producing food and/or does not explain that Teckana has a lower opportunity cost in producing food than Marland. Marland’s opportunity cost of producing one unit of food is 6 units of clothing (120/20=6) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqr1ngB PrgifHhDYfgasaacH8Xr=y0tbbg9q8qqaqpepec8Eeeq0tXdbba9fr Fj0=OqFL0dbba9LqpC0db9Fve9pce9v8qqaq=dir=xirpG0tb9fr=x fr=xfrpeWZqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaqaaqaaaOqaaabaaaaaaa aapeGaaiikaiaaigdacaaIYaGaaGimaiaac+cacaaIYaGaaGimaiab g2da9iaaiAdacaGGPaaaaa@424B@ .

The response states that Teckana has a comparative advantage in producing food and explains that Teckana has a lower opportunity cost in producing food than Marland. title: Part (c)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that the terms of trade are mutually beneficial and/or does not explain that the terms of trade fall between the opportunity costs of both countries (i.e., between 4 and 6 units of clothing).

The response states that the terms of trade are mutually beneficial and explains that the terms of trade fall between the opportunity costs of both countries (i.e., between 4 and 6 units of clothing).

title: Part (d)
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

The two criteria in Part D are not achieved independently. Students must draw a correctly labeled graph of Teckana’s initial PP C 1 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGqbGaamiuai aadoeadaWgaaWcbaGaaGymaaqabaaaaa@3C56@ in order to receive the first point. Receiving the second point is dependent on receiving the first point.
descriptions: The response does not accurately include either of the criteria below.
The response accurately includes the first criterion below, but not the second.
The response accurately includes both of the criteria below.
